properties.description: Must have one of 'picture', 'pictures' or 'animations' defined.

properties.name: random_variation_on_create
properties.description: Whether a random graphics variation is chosen when placing the entity/creating it via script/creating it via map generation. If this is false, the entity will use the first variation instead of a random one.

Particle.name: Particle
Particle.description: An entity with a limited lifetime that can use trigger effects.

properties.name: life_time
properties.description: Can't be 1.

properties.name: pictures
properties.description: Picture variation count and individual frame count must be equal to shadow variation count.

properties.name: fade_away_duration
properties.description: Defaults to life_time / 5, but at most 60. If this is 0, it is silently changed to 1.

properties.name: regular_trigger_effect_frequency
properties.description: Can't be 1.

properties.name: shadows
properties.description: Shadow variation variation count and individual frame count must be equal to picture variation count.

properties.name: vertical_acceleration
properties.description: Has to be >= -0.01 and <= 0.01.

ProduceAchievement.name: ProduceAchievement
ProduceAchievement.description: This prototype definition is used for receiving an achievement when the player produces more than the specified amount of items.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: This will set the amount of items or fluids needed to craft, for the player to complete the achievement.

properties.name: limited_to_one_game
properties.description: If this is false, the player carries over their statistics from this achievement through all their saves.

properties.name: fluid_product
properties.description: This will tell the achievement what fluid the player needs to craft, to get the achievement.

properties.name: item_product
properties.description: This will tell the achievement what item the player needs to craft, to get the achievement.

Corpse.name: Corpse
Corpse.description: Used for corpses, for example the remnants when destroying buildings.

properties.name: animation_overlay
properties.description: Variation count must be the same as animation variation count. Direction count must be the same as animation direction count. Frame count must be the same as animation frame count.

properties.name: direction_shuffle
properties.description: An array of arrays of integers. Arrays are called "groups" and must all have the same size.

properties.name: dying_speed
properties.description: Multiplier for #time_before_shading_off and #time_before_removed. Must be positive.

properties.name: time_before_removed
properties.description: Time in ticks this corpse lasts. May not be 0.

properties.name: time_before_shading_off
properties.description: Controls how long the corpse takes to fade, as in how long it takes to get from no transparency to full tranparency/removed. This time is not added to #time_before_removed, it is instead substracted from it. So by default, the corpse starts fading about 15 seconds before it gets removed.

AmmoCategory.name: AmmoCategory
AmmoCategory.description: An ammo category. Each weapon has an ammo category, and can use any ammo with the same ammo category. Ammo categories can also be upgraded by technologies.

Capsule.name: Capsule
Capsule.description: A capsule, for example a combat robot capsule or the raw fish.

properties.name: radius_color
properties.description: Color of the range radius that is shown around the player when they hold the capsule.

ItemWithEntityData.name: ItemWithEntityData
ItemWithEntityData.description: ItemWithEntityData saves data associated with the entity that it represents, for example the content of the equipment grid of a car.

NoiseLayer.name: NoiseLayer
NoiseLayer.description: A noise layer used by the autoplace system. For a list of built-in layers, see Data.raw#noise-layer.

Shortcut.name: Shortcut
Shortcut.description: Definition for a shortcut in the shortcut bar.

properties.name: associated_control_input
properties.description: Name of a custom input or vanilla control. Used to show the keybind in the tooltip of the shortcut.

properties.name: item_to_create
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Item. The item to create when clicking on a shortcut with the action set to "create-blueprint-item".

properties.name: style
properties.description: One of "default", "blue", "red" and "green".

properties.name: technology_to_unlock
properties.description: Name of a Prototype/Technology. The technology that must be researched before this shortcut can be used.

properties.name: toggleable
properties.description: Must be enabled for the Factorio API to be able to set the toggled state on the shortcut button, see LuaPlayer.set_shortcut_toggled.

Smoke.name: Smoke
Smoke.description: Abstract entity that has an animation.

properties.name: affected_by_wind
properties.description: Smoke always moves randomly unless movement_slow_down_factor is 0. If affected_by_wind is true, the smoke will also be moved by wind.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: May not be 0 if cyclic is true.

properties.name: fade_away_duration
properties.description: fade_in_duration + fade_away_duration must be <= duration.

properties.name: fade_in_duration
properties.description: fade_in_duration + fade_away_duration must be <= duration.

properties.name: movement_slow_down_factor
properties.description: Value between 0 and 1, with 0 being no movement.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: visual_merge_group
properties.description: Different walls will visually connect to each other if their merge group is the same.

properties.name: colors
properties.description: Array. Mandatory if variations exists.

properties.name: pictures
properties.description: Either this or variations must exist.

properties.name: variations
properties.description: Array. Can't be empty. Either this or pictures must exist.

RailSignalBase.name: RailSignalBase
RailSignalBase.description: The abstract base entity for both rail signals.

properties.name: circuit_connector_sprites
properties.description: Mandatory if circuit_wire_max_distance > 0.

properties.name: circuit_wire_connection_points
properties.description: Mandatory if circuit_wire_max_distance > 0.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

TransportBeltConnectable.name: TransportBeltConnectable
TransportBeltConnectable.description: Abstract class that anything that is a belt or can connect to belts uses

properties.name: speed
properties.description:
The speed of the belt (since 0.17): speed × 480 = x Items/second

The raw value is expressed as the number of tiles traveled by each item on the belt per tick, relative to the belt's maximum density - e.g. x items/second ÷ (4 items/lane × 2 lanes/belt × 60 ticks/second) = <speed> belts/tick where a "belt" is the size of one tile. See Transport_belts/Physics for more details.

properties.name: belt_animation_set
properties.description: Either this, or all of the properties below this one have to present.

properties.name: belt_horizontal
properties.description: Mandatory if belt_animation_set is not present.

properties.name: belt_vertical
properties.description: Mandatory if belt_animation_set is not present.

properties.name: ending_bottom
properties.description: Mandatory if belt_animation_set is not present.

properties.name: ending_patch
properties.description: Mandatory if belt_animation_set is not present.

properties.name: ending_side
properties.description: Mandatory if belt_animation_set is not present.

properties.name: ending_top
properties.description: Mandatory if belt_animation_set is not present.

properties.name: starting_bottom
properties.description: Mandatory if belt_animation_set is not present.

properties.name: starting_side
properties.description: Mandatory if belt_animation_set is not present.

properties.name: starting_top
properties.description: Mandatory if belt_animation_set is not present.

FluidStream.name: FluidStream
FluidStream.description: Used for example for the handheld flamethrower.

properties.name: particle_horizontal_speed
properties.description: Must be larger than 0. particle_horizontal_speed has to be greater than particle_horizontal_speed_deviation.

properties.name: particle_buffer_size
properties.description: Has to be less than 256.

properties.name: particle_fade_out_duration
properties.description: Will be set to 1 by the game if less than 1.

properties.name: particle_fade_out_threshold
properties.description: Value between 0 and 1.

properties.name: particle_loop_exit_threshold
properties.description: Value between 0 and 1.

properties.name: particle_loop_frame_count
properties.description: Will be set to 1 by the game if less than 1.

EnemySpawner.name: EnemySpawner
EnemySpawner.description: Can spawn entities. Used for biter/spitter nests.

properties.name: max_count_of_owned_units
properties.description: Count of enemies this spawner can sustain.

properties.name: max_friends_around_to_spawn
properties.description: How many friendly units are required within the spawning_radius of this spawner for it to stop producing more units.

properties.name: max_richness_for_spawn_shift
properties.description: Max richness to determine spawn shift. Spawn shift is linear interpolation between 0 and maxSpawnShift.

properties.name: max_spawn_shift
properties.description: Caps how much richness can be added on top of evolution when spawning units. (See also [1])

properties.name: result_units
properties.description: Array of the entities that this spawner can spawn and their spawn probabilities. The sum of probabilities is expected to be 1.0. The array must not be empty.

properties.name: spawning_cooldown
properties.description: Ticks for cooldown after unit is spawned.

properties.name: spawning_radius
properties.description: How far from the spawner can the units be spawned.

properties.name: spawning_spacing
properties.description: What spaces should be between the spawned units.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: The energy source of this mining drill.

properties.name: energy_usage
properties.description: The amount of energy used by the drill while mining. Can't be less than or equal to 0.

properties.name: mining_speed
properties.description: The speed of this drill.

properties.name: resource_categories
properties.description: The names of the Prototype/ResourceCategory that can be mined by this drill. For a list on built-in categories, see Data.raw#resource-category.

properties.name: resource_searching_radius
properties.description:
The distance from the centre of the mining drill to search for resources in.

This is 2.49 for electric mining drills (a 5x5 area) and 0.99 for burner mining drills (a 2x2 area). The drill searches resource outside its natural boundary box, which is 0.01 (the middle of the entity); making it 2.5 and 1.0 gives it another block radius.

properties.name: vector_to_place_result
properties.description: The position where the (mine) result is placed, when the mining drill is facing south (?).

properties.name: animations
properties.description: Loaded only if graphics_set does not exist.

properties.name: base_picture
properties.description: Used by the pumpjack to have a static 4 way sprite.

properties.name: base_productivity
properties.description: Productivity bonus that this machine always has.

properties.name: circuit_connector_sprites
properties.description: Mandatory if circuit_wire_max_distance > 0.

properties.name: circuit_wire_connection_points
properties.description: Mandatory if circuit_wire_max_distance > 0.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: monitor_visualization_tint
properties.description: When this mining drill is connected to the circuit network, the resource that it is reading (either the entire resource patch, or the resource in the mining area of the drill, depending on circuit network setting), is tinted in this color when mousing over the mining drill.

properties.name: radius_visualisation_picture
properties.description: The sprite used to show the range of the mining drill.

properties.name: storage_slots
properties.description: The output slot(s).

Tool.name: Tool
Tool.description: Items with a "durability". Used for science packs.

properties.name: durability
properties.description: The durability of this tool. Must be positive. Mandatory if infinite is false.

properties.name: infinite
properties.description: Whether this tool has infinite durability.

SolarPanelEquipment.name: SolarPanelEquipment
SolarPanelEquipment.description: Used by portable solar panel.

properties.name: power
properties.description: How much power should be provided.

EntityWithHealth.name: EntityWithHealth
EntityWithHealth.description: Abstract base of all entities with health in the game.

properties.name: corpse
properties.description: Specifies the name(s) of the Prototype/Corpse entity to be used when this entity dies.

properties.name: dying_explosion
properties.description: Either one ExplosionDefinition or an array of them. The entities that are spawned in place of this one when it dies.

properties.name: healing_per_tick
properties.description: The amount of health cured by tick naturally. Works only on active entities. (Todo explain)

properties.name: hide_resistances
properties.description: Whether the resistances of this entity should be hidden in the entity tooltip.

properties.name: integration_patch
properties.description: Sprite drawn on ground under the entity to make it feel more integrated into the ground.

properties.name: loot
properties.description: The loot is dropped on the ground when the entity is killed.

properties.name: max_health
properties.description: The unit health can never go over the maximum. Default health of units on creation is set to max. Must be greater than 0.

EquipmentGrid.name: EquipmentGrid
EquipmentGrid.description: The prototype of an equipment grid, for example the one used in a power armor.

properties.name: equipment_categories
properties.description: An array of Prototype/EquipmentCategory names. Only Prototype/Equipment with at least one of these categories can be inserted into the grid.

properties.name: locked
properties.description: Whether this locked from user interaction which means that the user cannot put equipment into or take equipment from this equipment grid.

LeafParticle.name: LeafParticle
LeafParticle.description: Deprecated in 0.18. Particles that are exclusively meant for leaves of trees. The type "leaf-particle" has been obsoleted and cannot be created. See Prototype/Particle for particles.

properties.name: category
properties.description: The name of a Prototype/ModuleCategory. Used when upgrading modules: Ctrl + click modules into an entity and it will replace lower tier modules of the same category with higher tier modules.

properties.name: tier
properties.description: Tier of the module inside its category. Used when upgrading modules: Ctrl + click modules into an entity and it will replace lower tier modules with higher tier modules if they have the same category.

properties.name: art_style
properties.description: Chooses with what art style the module is shown inside beacons. See Types/BeaconModuleVisualizations#art_style. Vanilla uses "vanilla" here.

properties.name: limitation
properties.description: Array of recipe names this module can be used on. If empty, the module can be used on all recipes.

properties.name: limitation_message_key
properties.description: Mandatory when limitation is present. The locale key of the message that is shown when the player attempts to use the module on a recipe it can't be used on. The locale key will be prefixed with item-limitation. (the "category" of the locale) by the game.

properties.name: energy_per_hit_point
properties.description: The (movement) energy used per hit point (1 hit point = 1 health damage) taken and dealt for this vehicle during collisions. The smaller the number, the more damage this vehicle and the rammed entity take during collisions: damage = energy / energy_per_hit_point.

properties.name: friction
properties.description: Two different ways to set friction force. At least one must exist. Must be positive.

properties.name: friction_force
properties.description: Two different ways to set friction force. At least one must exist. Must be positive.

properties.name: weight
properties.description: Must be positive. Weight of the entity used for physics calculation when car hits something.

properties.name: equipment_grid
properties.description: The name of the equipment grid this vehicle has.

properties.name: minimap_representation
properties.description: The sprite that represents this vehicle on the map/minimap.

properties.name: selected_minimap_representation
properties.description: The sprite that represents this vehicle on the map/minimap when it is selected.

properties.name: sound_minimum_speed
properties.description: Must be positive. Sound is scaled by speed.

properties.name: sound_scaling_ratio
properties.description: Must be positive. Sound is scaled by speed.

properties.name: terrain_friction_modifier
properties.description: Must be in the [0, 1] interval.

PlayerDamagedAchievement.name: PlayerDamagedAchievement
PlayerDamagedAchievement.description: This prototype definition is used for receiving an achievement when the player receives damage.

properties.name: minimum_damage
properties.description: This will trigger the achievement, if the amount of damage taken by the dealer, is more than this.

properties.name: should_survive
properties.description: This sets the achievement to only trigger, if you survive the minimum amount of damage. If you don't need to survive, false.

properties.name: type_of_dealer
properties.description: This will trigger the achievement, if the player takes damage from this specific entity type.

Decorative.name: Decorative
Decorative.description: Simple decorative purpose objects on the map, they have no health and some of them are removed when the player builds over. Usually used for grass patches, roots, small plants etc.

properties.name: pictures
properties.description: Must contain at least 1 picture.

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description: Must contain the [0,0] point. Max radius of the collision box is 8.

properties.name: tile_layer
properties.description: Mandatory if render_layer = "decals". This int16 is converted to a RenderLayer internally.

properties.name: trigger_effect
properties.description: Called by DestroyDecorativesTriggerEffectItem.

Pipe.name: Pipe
Pipe.description: An entity to transport gas and fluids over a distance, and between machines.

properties.name: fluid_box
properties.description: The area of the entity where fluid/gas inputs, and outputs.

properties.name: body
properties.description: Body segment of the beam. Must have at least 1 variation.

properties.name: damage_interval
properties.description: Damage interval can't be 0. A value of 1 will cause the attack to be applied each tick.

properties.name: head
properties.description: Head segment of the beam.

properties.name: tail
properties.description: Tail segment of the beam.

properties.name: action_triggered_automatically
properties.description: Whether this beams should trigger its action every damage_interval. If false, the action is instead triggered when its owner triggers shooting.

properties.name: ending
properties.description: End point of the beam.

properties.name: light_animations
properties.description: Lights are additively accumulated onto lightmap, which is multiplicatively rendered on the game world.[1]

properties.name: start
properties.description: Start point of the beam.

properties.name: start_light
properties.description: This and the below properties ending in "_light" are considered deprecated. If they are present, then light_animations and ground_light_animations are not loaded.

UtilitySounds.name: UtilitySounds
UtilitySounds.description: Sounds used by the game that are not specific to certain prototypes.

properties.name: flow_length_in_ticks
properties.description:
Must be positive.

Used for determining the x position inside the flow_sprite when drawing the storage tank. Does not affect gameplay.

The x position of the sprite will be ((game.tick % flow_length_in_ticks) ÷ flow_length_in_ticks) × (flow_sprite.width - 32). This means, that over flow_length_in_ticks ticks, the part of the flow_sprite that is drawn in-game is incrementally moved from most-left to most-right inside the actual sprite, that part always has a width of 32px. After flow_length_in_ticks, the part of the flow_sprite that is drawn will start from the left again.

properties.name: window_bounding_box
properties.description: The location of the window showing the contents. Note that for window_background the width and height are determined by the sprite and window_bounding_box only determines the drawing location. For fluid_background the width is determined by the sprite and the height and drawing location are determined by window_bounding_box.

properties.name: circuit_connector_sprites
properties.description: Mandatory if circuit_wire_max_distance > 0.

properties.name: circuit_wire_connection_points
properties.description: Mandatory if circuit_wire_max_distance > 0.

properties.name: scale_info_icons
properties.description: If the icons of fluids shown in alt-mode should be scaled to the storage tank's size.

SimpleEntityWithForce.name: SimpleEntityWithForce
SimpleEntityWithForce.description: This entity will be a priority target for units/turrets, who will choose to attack it even if it does not block their path. Use Prototype/SimpleEntityWithOwner for entities that are only attacked when they block enemies.

properties.name: animations
properties.description: Must have one of 'picture', 'pictures' or 'animations' defined.

properties.name: picture
properties.description: Must have one of 'picture', 'pictures' or 'animations' defined.

properties.name: pictures
properties.description: Must have one of 'picture', 'pictures' or 'animations' defined.

properties.name: random_variation_on_create
properties.description: Whether a random graphics variation is chosen when placing the entity/creating it via script/creating it via map generation. If this is false, the entity will use the first variation instead of a random one.

UtilityConstants.name: UtilityConstants
UtilityConstants.description: Constants used by the game that are not specific to certain prototypes. See utility-constants.lua for the values used by the base game.

properties.name: light_renderer_search_distance_limit
properties.description: Can be set to anything from range 0 to 255, but larger values will be clamped to 160. Setting it to larger values can have performance impact (growing geometrically).

properties.name: player_colors
properties.description: The inner tables have the following key/value pairs. The table with name = default must exist and be the first member of the array.

properties.name: default_trigger_target_mask_by_type
properties.description: The strings are entity types.

ArtilleryProjectile.name: ArtilleryProjectile
ArtilleryProjectile.description: The projectile shot by artillery.

properties.name: rotatable
properties.description: Whether the picture of the projectile is rotated to match the direction of travel.

Entity.name: Entity
Entity.description: Abstract base of all entities in the game. Entity is basically everything that can be on the map (except tiles). For in game script access to entity, take a look at LuaEntity

properties.name: additional_pastable_entities
properties.description: Entities this entity prototype can be pasted on to in addition to the standard supported types. This is used to allow copying between types that aren't compatible on the C++ code side, by allowing mods to receive the on_entity_settings_pasted event for the given entity and do the setting pasting via script.

properties.name: autoplace
properties.description: Used to specify the rules for placing this entity during map generation.

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description:
Specification of the entity collision boundaries.

Empty collision box is used for smoke, projectiles, particles, explosions etc.

collision_box = {{-0.4, -0.4}, {0.4, 0.4}}

The {0,0} coordinate in the collision box will match the entity position.

It should be near the center of the collision box, to keep correct entity drawing order. It must include the {0,0} coordinate.

Note, that for buildings, it is customary to leave 0.1 wide border between the edge of the tile and the edge of the building, this lets the player move between the building and electric poles/inserters etc.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Two entities can collide only if they share a layer from the collision mask.

properties.name: created_effect
properties.description: The effect/trigger that happens when the entity is placed.

properties.name: created_smoke
properties.description: The smoke that is shown when the entity is placed. Default is using the "smoke-building" smoke.

properties.name: drawing_box
properties.description:
Specification of space needed to see the whole entity.

This is used to calculate the correct zoom and positioning in the entity info gui.

properties.name: emissions_per_second
properties.description: Amount of emissions created (positive number) or cleaned (negative number) every second by the entity. This is passive, and it is independent concept of the emissions of machines, these are created actively depending on the power consumption. Currently used just for trees.

properties.name: fast_replaceable_group
properties.description:
This allows you to replace an entity that's already placed, with a different one in your inventory. For example, replacing a burner inserter with a fast inserter.

This is simply a string, so any string can be used here. The entity that should be replaced simply has to use the same string here.

properties.name: hit_visualization_box
properties.description: Where beams should hit the entity. Useful if the bounding box only covers part of the entity (e.g. feet of the character) and beams only hitting there would look weird.

properties.name: map_generator_bounding_box
properties.description: Used instead of the collision box during map generation. Allows space entities differently during map generation, for example if the box is bigger, the entities will be placed farther apart.

properties.name: next_upgrade
properties.description:
Name of the entity that will be automatically selected as the upgrade of this entity when using the upgrade planner without configuration.

This entity may not have 'not-upgradable' flag set and must be minable. This entity mining result must not contain item product with "hidden" flag set. Mining results with no item products are allowed. The entity may not be a Prototype/RollingStock.
The upgrade target entity needs to have the same bounding box, collision mask, and fast replaceable group as this entity. The upgrade target entity must have least 1 item that builds it that isn't hidden.

properties.name: placeable_by
properties.description:
Item that when placed creates this entity. Determines which item is picked when "Q" (smart pipette) is used on the entity, determines which item is needed in a blueprint of this entity.

The item count specified here can't be larger than the stack size of that item.

properties.name: remains_when_mined
properties.description: The entity that remains when this one is mined, deconstructed or fast-replaced. The entity wont actually be spawned if it would collide with the entity that is in the process of being mined.

properties.name: remove_decoratives
properties.description: Whether this entity should remove decoratives that collide with it when this entity is built.

properties.name: selection_box
properties.description:
Specification of the entity selection area. When empty the entity will have no selection area (and thus is not selectable).

The selection box is usually a little bit bigger than the collision box, for tilable entities (like buildings) it should match the tile size of the building.

properties.name: selection_priority
properties.description: The entity with the higher number is selectable before the entity with the lower number.

properties.name: shooting_cursor_size
properties.description: The cursor size used when shooting at this entity.

properties.name: sticker_box
properties.description: Used to set the area of the entity that can have stickers on it, currently only used for units to specify the area where the green slow down stickers can appear. It is optional and the collision box is used when not specified.

properties.name: subgroup
properties.description: The name of the subgroup this entity should be sorted into in the map editor building selection.

properties.name: tile_width
properties.description: Used to determine how the center of the entity should be positioned when building (unless the offgrid flag is specified). When the tile width is odd, the center will be in the center of the tile, when it is even, the center is on the tile transition.

properties.name: vehicle_impact_sound
properties.description: When playing this sound, the volume is scaled by the speed of the vehicle when colliding with this entity.

properties.name: water_reflection
properties.description: May also be defined inside graphics_set instead of directly in the entity prototype. This is useful for entities that use the a graphics_set property to define their graphics, becausen then all graphics can be in defined one place.

properties.name: working_sound
properties.description: Will also work on entities that don't actually do work.

DeconstructWithRobotsAchievement.name: DeconstructWithRobotsAchievement
DeconstructWithRobotsAchievement.description: This prototype definition is used for receiving an achievement when the player deconstructs enough entities with construction robots.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: This will trigger the achievement, if enough entities were deconstructed using construction robots.

Rail.name: Rail
Rail.description: The abstract base of both rail prototypes.

properties.name: walking_sound
properties.description: Sound played when a character walks over this rail.

properties.name: attack_parameters
properties.description: Requires animation in attack_parameters. Requires ammo_type in attack_parameters.

properties.name: distance_per_frame
properties.description: How fast the run_animation frames are advanced. The animations are advanced animation_speed frames per distance_per_frame that the unit moves.

properties.name: movement_speed
properties.description: Movement speed of the unit in the world, in tiles per tick. Must be equal to or greater than 0.

properties.name: pollution_to_join_attack
properties.description: The amount of pollution that has to be absorbed by the unit's spawner before the unit will leave the spawner and attack the source of the pollution.

properties.name: vision_distance
properties.description: Note: Setting to 50 or above can lead to undocumented behavior of individual units creating groups on their own when attacking or being attacked.

properties.name: dying_sound
properties.description: The sound file to play when entity dies.

properties.name: has_belt_immunity
properties.description: If the unit is immune to movement by belts.

properties.name: running_sound_animation_positions
properties.description: Ignored if walking_sounds is not defined.

properties.name: ammo_type
properties.description:
When using an array of AmmoType, the AmmoType has an extra property:

  • source_type - AmmoSourceType - Mandatory. - Defines for which kind of entity this ammo type applies. Each entity kind can only be used once per array.

When using a plain AmmoType, the ammo type applies to everything ("default").

properties.name: magazine_size
properties.description: Number of shots before ammo item is consumed. Must be >= 1.

properties.name: reload_time
properties.description: Amount of extra time (in ticks) it takes to reload the weapon after depleting the magazine. Must be >= 0.
